SASKATCHEWAN ARCHIVES QUESTIONNAIRES

No. 2

PIONEER EXPERIENCES: A GENERAL QUESTIONNAIRE

NOTE: Please print all proper names and place names in capital letters. If you are not sure how names are spelled or if you have given them, please say so. If you rather have someone else do the writing at your dictation, this is quite acceptable.

1. Your full name: Mrs. Ella Garvin Garvin
2. Your address: Moravia, ONT.
3. Date: May 14, 1936
4. Where were you born? (Give name of place and country): Moravia, ONT.
5. What was your father's name and occupation?: Geo. Tracy
6. When did you come to Saskatchewan? (Give month and year): May 1885
7. Mention any other places where you lived before coming to Saskatchewan, giving dates wherever possible.: ONT.
8. How old were you when you first came to Western Canada? (You do not need to give your age now.) I am 77 years old.
9. What were your reasons for coming West?: To earn a living and provide for my family.
10. How did you learn about the West? (Through other people? Reading about it? Railroad or government information?): Homesteaded land up a homestead in 1885.

23. Is there any particular experience of pioneer days that stand out in your memory which you would like to record?

We had a horse named "Old Joe" who was very faithful to us. He always knew when we needed him and would come running when called.

24. Did you travel about much in the early years? (For business, attending church, visiting friends, etc.) How often?

25. Did you have a bed? We only had sleeping bags at first until we could afford a bed.

26. What was the weather like in the winter?

21. Did anyone else come to Saskatchewan because of your recommendation? If so, who?

22. If other members of your family (brothers, sisters, parents, etc.) came West, tell when they came and where they settled.

Later you say we came West. We went to see all my brothers & sisters.

Brother 1887

Brother 1890

Brother 1890

23. Is there any particular experience of pioneer days that stands out in your memory which you would like to record?

We had a store - Wallace P.O. We had a general store - Wallace P.O. We had a store - Wallace P.O. We had a store - Wallace P.O.

Had a team of horses - often took no.

Church service was held in a house at Wallace. Mother first of Baptist church.

We had a big story house - the minutes came to stay with one time use.

24. Did you travel about much in the early years? (For business, attending church, visiting friends, etc.) How often?

Sleeping arrangements were very simple. We used the floor. We knew what minutes to place on the morning the next day.

On the floor - in the morning on the floor.
25. When was the first car used in the community? — Garvin Ella

26. If you owned a car before 1914, when did you buy it? — 1909

27. Where was your trading center? How far from your house? — Wallace

28. Did you continue to make there? (Initiate any changes due to new towns appearing, better means of travel, etc.) — Yes

29. How often did you shop in the early days? — Probably three times a week

30. Then (if ever) did people in your district first start going to town regularly on Saturdays? — Yes

31. What kind of articles did you buy in this way? — Indicates also what fractions of your total purchases were by mail order and by personal purchase

32. When did you first have a telephone and what company provided it? — No

33. When you came to Saskatchewan the first time was it with the idea of staying permanently? Or did you make up your mind after trying it out? When did you make this decision? — Yes

26. If you owned a car before 1914, then did you buy it?

33. When you came to Basaltobowan the first time was it with the idea of staying permanently? Or did you make up your mind after trying it out? When did you make this decision?

We brought most of our supplies in family early quantities from Broadview.
34. Did any people move away from your district prior to 1947? That reason did

We were on the move too

35. Did many people move away during the 1930s? Did many returning?

They were in Montana & Idaho

36. If you or some member of your family have held public office, or have been active in any organizations, mention it here, giving dates whenever possible.

The first automobile, combine, organizing the church, etc.

37. If you or any of your family or friends were retired to have or do something in the district, mention it here, giving dates whenever possible.

My husband was the first man to own a Union Church (1902-1907) We on the first church board also organized the first Union Church Board and organized the first United Church (1911)

38. How did the place in your community get its name? (Specify district, town, city, etc.) Try to give (1) date of its adoption, (2) any changes in its name since then, (3) date and reason for change.

Give faster of your name as above in (1) (2) (3).

Dear Robert
34. Did any people move away from your district prior to 1947? If so, why did they have to leave?

We were on the move too.

35. Did anyone die during the 1900-1947 period?

They were in Okotoks, Alberta.

36. If you or some members of your family have held public offices, or have been active in any organizations, mention it here, giving dates whenever possible.

37. If you or any of your family or friends were written up in newspapers, or have done anything else that might be of interest to others, mention it here.

My husband was at the first annual meeting of the United Church at the new church building.

The Bible School (1902-1907) was on the farm ground.

Board of Trustees organized the Sunday School.

Maurice Houlton attended the first United Church.

38. How did the places in your community get their names? (school, streets, etc.)

39. Any other information you would like to add about your community?

40. Any suggestions for future planning?

41. Any changes in the town since the last census? (Yes/No)

42. Any other comments?

Poveshell

Lewis H. Thomas, Esq.,
Provincial Archivist,
Saskatoon.

Dear Sir:

Can you or anyone you know me a questionaire: Since I have my mother living with me and she is really a pioneer I thought it better to get information from her. She will be 83 in July and is quite well. However on Jan 14th of this year she fell and fractured a hip. She is able to walk some now with the assistance of a cane but of course is fairly weak. Prior to the accident she was quite chirpier. Never missed a meal, even like a child and did not have an ache or pain in her eye sight is getting rather poor and he hearing is about gone. But other than that she was quite fine.

I trust the bit of information I was able to get from her will be of some interest.

[Signature]

G.T. Garryn

I was born at Saltcoats, Ayrshire, N.Y.T., in 1900. I believe the first way had reached there by that time and possibly had gotten as far as Yorkton. I can remember that for years...
Dear Sir:

Ten days ago you sent me a questionnaire. Since I have my mother living with me and she is really a pioneer I thought it better to get information from her. She will be 83 in July and is quite well. However on Jan 14th of this year she fell and fractured a rib. She is able to walk some now with the assistance of a cane but of course is fairly weak. Prior to the accident she was quite chirpier! Never missed a meal, even like a child and did not have an ache or pain.

Her eye sight is getting rather poor and her hearing is about gone. But other than that she was quite fine.

I trust the bit of information I was able to get from her will be of some interest.

Yours Truly,

[Signature]

C.T. Galvin

I was born at Colton, N.Y., in 1900. I believe the first train had reached there by that time and possibly had gotten as far as Yorkton. I can remember that for years...

39. Questions regarding historical source materials:
Do you have in your possession or do you know the whereabouts of diaries, old letters, old posters and newspapers, minute books of community organizations, old pamphlets, old photographs, written recollections and reminiscences? (Describe).

Would you or the person who owns them either:
(1) be willing to lend them to the Provincial Archivist for copying?
(2) be willing to present them to the Archives Division of the Legislative Library, Regina, or the Archives Office at the University in Saskatoon? (Indicate your preference, if any)

Sons:

- Fa. - Paul Thomas, Lawyer, Vancouver

Daughters:

- Grandchildren - Bob and children in Toronto

41. What do you think are the most important changes in your community since you first came West?

More beautiful homes - cars etc.

Pearl (married - Mrs. Toews)

41. What do you think are the most important changes in your community since you first came West?

Most Log buildings + stores & etc.
Beautiful homes - Caron & etc.

What other will be 93 years old by 1978 & quit heart, the end of the world year.
Will continue to trip in jaw of the day.
Her now able to walk with the aid of a cane.
